item.title: Catherine add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "There are three things men can do with women: love them, suffer them, or turn them into literature." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Catherine add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "There is nothing so annoying as having two people talking when you're busy interrupting." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Catherine add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Good breeding consists of concealing how much we think of ourselves and how little we think of the other person." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Catherine add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "I do not like work even when someone else is doing it." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Catherine add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "I was sorry to have my name mentioned as one of the great authors, because they have a sad habit of dying off. Chaucer is dead, Spencer is dead, so is Milton, so is Shakespeare, and Iâ€™m not feeling so well myself." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Catherine add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Explaining humor is a lot like dissecting a frog, you learn a lot in the process, but in the end you kill it." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Catherine add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The proper office of a friend is to side with you when you are in the wrong. Nearly anybody will side with you when you are in the right." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Catherine add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The secret of getting ahead is getting started. The secret of getting started is breaking your complex overwhelming tasks into small manageable tasks, and starting on the first one." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Catherine add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Every man is a moon and has a side which he turns toward nobody: you have to slip around behind it if you want to see it." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Catherine add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "I have been complimented many times and they always embarrass me; I always feel they have not said enough." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Catherine add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "If you don't know how to pronounce a word, say it loudly. Do not compound mispronunciation with inaudibility" -- Mark Twain

item.title: Catherine add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "If a person offends you, and you are in doubt as to whether it was intentional or not, do not resort to extreme measures; simply watch your chance, and hit him with a brick." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Catherine add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Whoever is happy will make others happy too." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Catherine add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Cauliflower is nothing but cabbage with a college education." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Catherine add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "At noon I observed a bevy of nude young native women bathing in the sea, and I went and sat down on there clothes to keep them from being stolen." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Catherine add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "I have never taken any exercise except sleeping and resting." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Catherine add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Wilson stopped and stood silent. Inattention dies a quick and sure death when a speaker does that." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Catherine add a quote by mark twain
item.description: "Always read stuff that will make you look good if you die in the middle of it." -- mark twain

item.title: Catherine add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "What a wee little part of a person's life are his acts and his words! His real life is lead in his head, and is known to none but himself. All day long, and every day, the mill of his brain is grinding, and his thoughts, (which are but the mute articulation of his feelings,) not those other things are his history. His acts and his words are merely the visible thin crust of his world, with its scattered snow summits and its vacant wastes of water-and they are so trifling a part of his bulk! a mere skin enveloping it. The mass of him is hidden-it and its volcanic fires that toss and boil, and never rest, night nor day. These are his life, and they are not written, and cannot be written." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Catherine add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Such is the human race. Often it seems such a pity that Noah.. didn't miss the boat." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Catherine add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Are you an American? No, I am not <i>an</i> American. I am <i>the</i> American." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Catherine add a quote by Elizabeth Wurtzel
item.description: "I don't want any more of this try, try again stuff. I just want out. Iâ€™ve had it. I am so tired. I am twenty and I am already exhausted." -- Elizabeth Wurtzel

item.title: Catherine add a quote by Kay Redfield Jamison
item.description: "Others imply that they know what it is like to be depressed because they have gone through a divorce, lost a job, or broken up with someone. But these experiences carry with them feelings. Depression, instead, is flat, hollow, and unendurable. It is also tiresome. People cannot abide being around you when you are depressed. They might think that they ought to, and they might even try, but you know and they know that you are tedious beyond belief: you are irritable and paranoid and humorless and lifeless and critical and demanding and no reassurance is ever enough. You're frightened, and you're frightening, and you're "not at all like yourself but will be soon," but you know you won't." -- Kay Redfield Jamison

item.title: Catherine add a quote by Elizabeth Wurtzel
item.description: "In my case, I was not frightened in the least bit at the thought that I might live because I was certain, quite certain, that I was already dead. " -- Elizabeth Wurtzel

item.title: Catherine add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "Solitary trees, if they grow at all, grow strong.." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: Catherine add a quote by Jerome K. Jerome
item.description: "I like work: it fascinates me. I can sit and look at it for hours." -- Jerome K. Jerome

item.title: Catherine add a quote by Jerome K. Jerome
item.description: "It takes 3 girls to tow always; two to hold the rope, and the other one runs round and round, and giggles." -- Jerome K. Jerome

item.title: Catherine add a quote by Jerome K. Jerome
item.description: "It is so pleasant to come across people more stupid than ourselves. We love them at once for being so." -- Jerome K. Jerome

item.title: Catherine add a quote by Jerome K. Jerome
item.description: "If you are foolish enough to be contented, don't show it, but grumble with the rest; and if you can do with a little, ask for a great deal. Because if you don't you won't get any." -- Jerome K. Jerome

item.title: Catherine add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "If one cannot enjoy reading a book over and over again, there is no use in reading it at all." -- Oscar Wilde
